headline: Gorilla trekking is worth the cost for most travelers
summary: At $1,500 per permit in Rwanda, gorilla trekking is expensive but delivers an encounter unlike any other wildlife experience. The hour spent with a habituated gorilla family is consistently rated as life-changing by those who do it. For travelers who can afford it without financial strain, it is generally worth prioritizing over additional safari days.

assumptions.text: Rwanda gorilla permits cost $1,500 per person; Uganda permits cost $700.
Gorilla trekking is consistently rated as a peak travel experience by those who do it.
Gorilla sightings are essentially guaranteed with habituated groups.

gains: One hour of close proximity to gorilla family
losses: Trek can be physically demanding (1-6 hours hiking)
Only one hour with gorillas after reaching them

change_conditions: If the permit cost would cause financial strain, consider Uganda at $700 per permit.
If physical fitness is limited, confirm porter availability and average trek lengths.
If already planning multiple safaris, consider whether gorillas should be first priority.
